intro: Draba australis var. ameghinoi, commonly known as the Patagonian whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many cruciferous plants. This variety is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to temperate climates. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
